content:
Our weekly podcast on the markets, the economy and the world of business

HOW WILL the Trump administration’s restrictions on American companies selling products to Huawei affect the Chinese telecoms giant? Can the world’s second biggest smartphone maker adapt to not doing business with America? Also, Michael Froman , a former US trade representative and the vice-chairman of MasterCard, discusses how private companies can promote freer trade . And Jennifer Eberhardt , a professor of psychology at Stanford University, explains  the science of racial bias . Simon Long hosts. Runtime: 22mins

Listen on: Apple Podcasts  |  Spotify  |  Google  |  Stitcher  |  TuneIn

eg2: Why is this book in the  section?
为什么这本书在心理学专区？
It was not until the mid-twentieth century that  really came into its own.
直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。
His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

wp.racial hygiene: 种族优生;种族卫生;生政策
wp.Racial difference: 种族差异;种族差别;群差异
wp.Racial Issues: 美国种族问题;种族问题
wp.Racial tension: 种族关系紧张;种族紧张

eg2: He went on record as opposing racial discrimination.
他公开表示反对种族歧视。
The answer from some scientists who still do what could be called " science" appears to be yes on both counts.
来自仍然在做可以称之为“种族科学”的科学家们的答案，似乎这两个理由都对。
Because not only are we not comfortable talking about racial issues, but we also usually have one or two racist attitudes ourselves. (You don't have to admit it to me.
因为在谈及种族问题时，我们不仅是感到不舒服，而且通常我们自身也有一两种种族主义倾向。 （您不必向我承认它，不要担心。）
